start.message: Hi! I'm Gurmol's virtual assistant. What would you like to know?

who.message: Gurmol Sohi is a Calgary-based data developer and innovator who transitioned from pre-med (BSc Biological Sciences) to tech. He's currently pursuing an MSc in Data Science at the University of Calgary and working as a Business Analyst at Halo Health. He's actively involved in Calgary's tech ecosystem through hackathons, bootcamps, and community leadership.

background.message: Gurmol earned his BSc in Biological Sciences from the University of Calgary (2015-2020). During his studies, he discovered a passion for data and coding, leading him to pivot from pre-med to technology. He completed multiple bootcamps including Lighthouse Labs, SAIT Data Analytics, AMII Machine Learning, and Npower Calgary.

certs.message:
Gurmol has completed:
‚Ä¢ IBM Data Analyst Certificate
‚Ä¢ Google PM Certificate
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure Certifications (DP-900, AZ-900, AI-900)
‚Ä¢ Lighthouse Labs Data Analytics Bootcamp
‚Ä¢ SAIT Post-Diploma Data Analytics
‚Ä¢ AMII Machine Learning Program
‚Ä¢ Npower Calgary Junior Data Analyst Program

pivot.message: Gurmol's pivot from pre-med to tech was inspired by discovering data science during his biological sciences degree. Instead of pursuing medical school, he threw himself into the tech ecosystem, participating in hackathons, completing bootcamps, and building real-world projects. His story has been featured in podcasts like 'The Rejected Pre-Med Podcast' and 'Leaders, Innovators and Big Ideas'.

medium.message:

cybera.message: At Cybera Inc, Gurmol was an Applied Data Science Lab (ADSL) Intern focusing on computer vision. He developed computer vision models to calculate distances among objects and conduct object detection. He's an alumnus of the Cybera Electron cohort and was also a NeuroNexus competition innovator!

experience.message: Gurmol has diverse experience in data science, machine learning, and analytics. He's worked across multiple industries including healthcare tech, agriculture (Nutrien), AI research (AMII), computer vision (Cybera), and biotech analysis (Motionhall). He's also passionate about education, teaching programming to young learners at MakerKids.
